content:
I'm happy to help with language learning app recommendations, but I have to clarify that I don't have any information about your conversation with Alex or the speed networking event in Santa Monica last month.

That being said, I can suggest some popular language learning apps that you might find useful:

1. Duolingo: A gamified language learning platform with a large community and a wide range of languages.
2. Babbel: A comprehensive language learning app with interactive lessons and a focus on conversational skills.
3. Rosetta Stone: A well-known language learning platform with a structured approach and speech recognition technology.
4. Anki: A flashcard app that uses spaced repetition to help you memorize vocabulary and phrases.
5. Memrise: A language learning app that uses spaced repetition and a large community-driven database of content.
6. Quizlet: A study app that offers flashcards, tests, and study games for language learners.
7. HelloTalk: A language learning app that connects you with native speakers for language exchange and practice.
8. Lingodeer: A language learning app that offers interactive lessons and games for kids and adults.

These are just a few examples, and there are many more language learning apps available. You might find it helpful to try out a few and see which one works best for you.

Remember, I'm just an AI, I don't have personal experiences or memories, so I didn't attend the speed networking event in Santa Monica last month, and I didn't have a conversation with Alex.
